text:
Thanks <@UDHT6N5SM>, this is helpful. The article recommends using a sandbox account for development and a PROD account for the published site. I’m curious how that works in practice. Seems like you’d have issues with content missing or being out of date on the sandbox site.

Is there a best practice for developing against with live content?

HubSpot is working on it but there isn't a really great solution at the moment. I think, at least previously, HubSpot sees the sandbox account as a place to test templates and editable fields. They want you to use "content staging" in the prod account to actually modify content—all "real" content lives in prod
Thanks. I’m not familiar with “content staging”. Is that essentially creating drafts with new page content?

Hi everyone! I'm pretty new to HS and I'm excited to dive in. I was interested in building graphs/charts modules for a few of our landing pages within HS. Can anyone direct me on how to get started on this?
Hey there we have a tutorial that shows you how to create modules and enable content creators to fill them with content. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-modules>

As far as the graphing/charting there are a lot of different techniques and libraries out there. Just search for “JavaScript graphing/charting library”  “SVG graphs” or “CSS based graphs”. From there you should be able to figure out which option makes the most sense to you.
It's a little hidden but here's some info: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/content-staging>
thanks for the direction and tips! I'll give it a go :slightly_smiling_face:
if you go to Marketing > Website > Website pages (top nav)
and then More tools > Content staging (left nav)
you can clone live pages, make your changes, preview/qa them, and then publish
it's how you handle strictly content changes and/or swapping to a new template

Hey everyone! :wave: My name is Wes, i’m a web designer & developer from western Canada. I’m brand new to the platform and very excited to learn and grow with the community, and to contribute where I can!  All the best.
